VariableDescription.Name: Bandwidth
VariableDescription.Header:
#              ************************************
#              *****    GLOBAL ATTRIBUTES    ******
#              ************************************
#
#     TITLE                           CLUSTER WBD
#     PROJECT                         STSP>Solar Terrestrial Science Programme, Cluster
#     DISCIPLINE                      Space Physics>Magnetospheric Science
#     SOURCE_NAME                     C3>Cluster spacecraft 3
#     DATA_TYPE                       waveform
#     DESCRIPTOR                      WBD>Wide Band Data Plasma Wave Receiver
#     DATA_VERSION                    1
#     TEXT                            High time resolution calibrated waveform data sampled in one of 3 frequency                            
#     TEXT                             bands in the range 0-577 kHz along one axis using either an electric field                            
#     TEXT                             antenna or a magnetic search coil sensor.  The dataset also includes instrument                       
#     TEXT                             mode, data quality and the angles required to orient the measurement with respect                     
#                                      to the magnetic field and to the GSE coordinate system.                                               
#                                     ...
#                                     CALIBRATION:
#                                     ...
#                                     The procedure used in computing the calibrated Electric Field and Magnetic Field                       
#                                      values found in this file can be obtained from the document 'cluster_wbd_calibration.pdf'.            
#                                      Because the calibration was applied in the time domain using a simple equation                        
#                                      the raw counts actually measured by the WBD instrument can be obtained by using                       
#                                      these equations and solving for 'Raw Counts', keeping in mind that this number                        
#                                      is an Integer ranging from 0 to 255.  Since DC offset is a real number, the                           
#                                      resultant when solving for raw counts will need to be converted to the nearest                        
#                                      whole number.                                                                                         
#                                     ...
#                                     CONVERSION TO FREQUENCY DOMAIN:
#                                     ...
#                                     In order to convert the WBD data to the frequency domain via an FFT, the following                     
#                                      steps need to be carried out:  1) If Electric Field, first divide calibrated                          
#                                      data values by 1000 to get V/m; 2) Apply window of preference, if any (such                           
#                                      as Hanning, etc.); 3) Divide data values by sqrt(2) to get back to the rms                            
#                                      domain; 4) perform FFT (see Bandwidth variable notes for non-continuous modes);                       
#                                      5) divide by the noise bandwidth, which is equal to the sampling frequency                            
#                                      divided by the FFT size (see table below for appropriate sampling frequency);                         
#                                      6) multiply by the appropriate constant for the window used, if any.                                  
#                                     ...
#                                     Bandwidth   Sample Rate
#                                     ---------   ------------
#                                     9.5 kHz      27.443 kHz
#                                     19 kHz       54.886 kHz
#                                     77 kHz      219.544 kHz
#                                     ...
#                                     COORDINATE SYSTEM USED:
#                                     ...
#                                     One axis measurements made in the Antenna Coordinate System, i.e., if electric                         
#                                      field measurement, it will either be Ey or Ez, both of which are in the spin                          
#                                      plane of the spacecraft, and if magnetic field measurement, it will either                            
#                                      be Bx, along the spin axis, or By, in spin plane.                                                     
#                                     ...
#     MODS                            Created Mar 2008.Revised Dec 2008, Jan 2010
#     ADID_REF                        NSSD0171
#     LOGICAL_FILE_ID                 c3_waveform_wbd_yyyymmddhhmm_v01
#     LOGICAL_SOURCE                  c3_waveform_wbd
#     LOGICAL_SOURCE_DESCRIPTION      Cluster Wideband Data Plasma Wave Receiver/High Time Resolution Waveform Data
#     PI_NAME                         2006 - Current:  J. S. Pickett; 1988 - 2006:  D. A. Gurnett
#     PI_AFFILIATION                  The University of  Iowa
#     MISSION_GROUP                   Cluster
#     INSTRUMENT_TYPE                 Radio and Plasma Waves (space)
#     HTTP_LINK                       http://www-pw.physics.uiowa.edu/cluster/
#                                     http://www.cosmos.esa.int/web/csa
#     GENERATION_DATE                 2010-01-20T16:43:37.000Z.
#     LINK_TITLE                      Cluster Wideband Plasma Wave Investigation
#                                     Cluster Science Archive
#     ACKNOWLEDGEMENT                 Users of the Cluster WBD data are encouraged to acknowledge NASA Goddard Space                         
#                                      Flight Center and The University of Iowa as the source of the data in any publication.                
#     RULES_OF_USE                    Cluster WBD data are open to everyone.  However, users of these data are encouraged                    
#                                      to contact the PI Institute should questions arise.                                                   
#     TIME_RESOLUTION                 1.0/Sample_rate
#     LINK_TEXT                       Overview and high time resolution spectrograms, documentation, and data coverage                       
#                                      files                                                                                                 
#                                     High time resolution spectrograms, documentation, and data coverage files
#     FILE_NAMING_CONVENTION          source_datatype_descriptor
#
#              ************************************
#              ****  RECORD VARYING VARIABLES  ****
#              ************************************
#
#  1. UT Time, time of WBD data point
#       NOTES:  On-board time is corrected to a precision of order 50 microseconds when compared to UTC. The applied time correction comes from the DWP TCOR time correction files located at the Cluster Active Archive (CAA).
#  2. Frequency Bandwidth: 9.5 kHz, 19 kHz, 77 kHz
#       NOTES:  WARNING:  19 and 77 kHz Bandwidth modes with 8-bit resolution, and 77 kHz Bandwidth mode with 4-bit resolution (see Resolution variable) are not continuous data modes.  Always check for periodic time jumps for these modes.
#
#  
# Key Parameter and Survey data (labels K0,K1,K2) are preliminary browse data.
# Generated by CDAWeb on: Thu Jan 15 18:46:48 2015
VariableDescription.VariableInfo:
#       NOTES:  WARNING:  19 and 77 kHz Bandwidth modes with 8-bit resolution, and 77 kHz Bandwidth mode with 4-bit resolution (see Resolution variable) are not continuous data modes.  Always check for periodic time jumps for these modes.
#
EPOCH                                   BANDWIDTH
dd-mm-yyyy hh:mm:ss.mil.mic.nan.pic           kHz
03-02-2001 05:26:28.017.836.999.999       77.0000

VariableDescription.LongDescription: Total angle between antenna used for WBD measurement and measured B field direction
VariableDescription.Header:
#              ************************************
#              *****    GLOBAL ATTRIBUTES    ******
#              ************************************
#
#     TITLE                           CLUSTER WBD
#     PROJECT                         STSP>Solar Terrestrial Science Programme, Cluster
#     DISCIPLINE                      Space Physics>Magnetospheric Science
#     SOURCE_NAME                     C3>Cluster spacecraft 3
#     DATA_TYPE                       waveform
#     DESCRIPTOR                      WBD>Wide Band Data Plasma Wave Receiver
#     DATA_VERSION                    1
#     TEXT                            High time resolution calibrated waveform data sampled in one of 3 frequency                            
#     TEXT                             bands in the range 0-577 kHz along one axis using either an electric field                            
#     TEXT                             antenna or a magnetic search coil sensor.  The dataset also includes instrument                       
#     TEXT                             mode, data quality and the angles required to orient the measurement with respect                     
#                                      to the magnetic field and to the GSE coordinate system.                                               
#                                     ...
#                                     CALIBRATION:
#                                     ...
#                                     The procedure used in computing the calibrated Electric Field and Magnetic Field                       
#                                      values found in this file can be obtained from the document 'cluster_wbd_calibration.pdf'.            
#                                      Because the calibration was applied in the time domain using a simple equation                        
#                                      the raw counts actually measured by the WBD instrument can be obtained by using                       
#                                      these equations and solving for 'Raw Counts', keeping in mind that this number                        
#                                      is an Integer ranging from 0 to 255.  Since DC offset is a real number, the                           
#                                      resultant when solving for raw counts will need to be converted to the nearest                        
#                                      whole number.                                                                                         
#                                     ...
#                                     CONVERSION TO FREQUENCY DOMAIN:
#                                     ...
#                                     In order to convert the WBD data to the frequency domain via an FFT, the following                     
#                                      steps need to be carried out:  1) If Electric Field, first divide calibrated                          
#                                      data values by 1000 to get V/m; 2) Apply window of preference, if any (such                           
#                                      as Hanning, etc.); 3) Divide data values by sqrt(2) to get back to the rms                            
#                                      domain; 4) perform FFT (see Bandwidth variable notes for non-continuous modes);                       
#                                      5) divide by the noise bandwidth, which is equal to the sampling frequency                            
#                                      divided by the FFT size (see table below for appropriate sampling frequency);                         
#                                      6) multiply by the appropriate constant for the window used, if any.                                  
#                                     ...
#                                     Bandwidth   Sample Rate
#                                     ---------   ------------
#                                     9.5 kHz      27.443 kHz
#                                     19 kHz       54.886 kHz
#                                     77 kHz      219.544 kHz
#                                     ...
#                                     COORDINATE SYSTEM USED:
#                                     ...
#                                     One axis measurements made in the Antenna Coordinate System, i.e., if electric                         
#                                      field measurement, it will either be Ey or Ez, both of which are in the spin                          
#                                      plane of the spacecraft, and if magnetic field measurement, it will either                            
#                                      be Bx, along the spin axis, or By, in spin plane.                                                     
#                                     ...
#     MODS                            Created Mar 2008.Revised Dec 2008, Jan 2010
#     ADID_REF                        NSSD0171
#     LOGICAL_FILE_ID                 c3_waveform_wbd_yyyymmddhhmm_v01
#     LOGICAL_SOURCE                  c3_waveform_wbd
#     LOGICAL_SOURCE_DESCRIPTION      Cluster Wideband Data Plasma Wave Receiver/High Time Resolution Waveform Data
#     PI_NAME                         2006 - Current:  J. S. Pickett; 1988 - 2006:  D. A. Gurnett
#     PI_AFFILIATION                  The University of  Iowa
#     MISSION_GROUP                   Cluster
#     INSTRUMENT_TYPE                 Radio and Plasma Waves (space)
#     HTTP_LINK                       http://www-pw.physics.uiowa.edu/cluster/
#                                     http://www.cosmos.esa.int/web/csa
#     GENERATION_DATE                 2010-01-20T16:43:37.000Z.
#     LINK_TITLE                      Cluster Wideband Plasma Wave Investigation
#                                     Cluster Science Archive
#     ACKNOWLEDGEMENT                 Users of the Cluster WBD data are encouraged to acknowledge NASA Goddard Space                         
#                                      Flight Center and The University of Iowa as the source of the data in any publication.                
#     RULES_OF_USE                    Cluster WBD data are open to everyone.  However, users of these data are encouraged                    
#                                      to contact the PI Institute should questions arise.                                                   
#     TIME_RESOLUTION                 1.0/Sample_rate
#     LINK_TEXT                       Overview and high time resolution spectrograms, documentation, and data coverage                       
#                                      files                                                                                                 
#                                     High time resolution spectrograms, documentation, and data coverage files
#     FILE_NAMING_CONVENTION          source_datatype_descriptor
#
#              ************************************
#              ****  RECORD VARYING VARIABLES  ****
#              ************************************
#
#  1. UT Time, time of WBD data point
#       NOTES:  On-board time is corrected to a precision of order 50 microseconds when compared to UTC. The applied time correction comes from the DWP TCOR time correction files located at the Cluster Active Archive (CAA).
#  2. Total angle between antenna used for WBD measurement and measured B field direction
#       NOTES:  Antenna refers to the antenna in use, either E or B.  See ANTENNA variable.
#
#  
# Key Parameter and Survey data (labels K0,K1,K2) are preliminary browse data.
# Generated by CDAWeb on: Thu Jan 15 18:53:37 2015
VariableDescription.VariableInfo:
#       NOTES:  Antenna refers to the antenna in use, either E or B.  See ANTENNA variable.
#
EPOCH                                   ANT-B_ANG
dd-mm-yyyy hh:mm:ss.mil.mic.nan.pic       degrees
03-02-2001 05:26:28.017.836.999.999       96.3267

VariableDescription.Name: WBD_Mag
VariableDescription.Header:
#              ************************************
#              *****    GLOBAL ATTRIBUTES    ******
#              ************************************
#
#     TITLE                           CLUSTER WBD
#     PROJECT                         STSP>Solar Terrestrial Science Programme, Cluster
#     DISCIPLINE                      Space Physics>Magnetospheric Science
#     SOURCE_NAME                     C3>Cluster spacecraft 3
#     DATA_TYPE                       waveform
#     DESCRIPTOR                      WBD>Wide Band Data Plasma Wave Receiver
#     DATA_VERSION                    1
#     TEXT                            High time resolution calibrated waveform data sampled in one of 3 frequency                            
#     TEXT                             bands in the range 0-577 kHz along one axis using either an electric field                            
#     TEXT                             antenna or a magnetic search coil sensor.  The dataset also includes instrument                       
#     TEXT                             mode, data quality and the angles required to orient the measurement with respect                     
#                                      to the magnetic field and to the GSE coordinate system.                                               
#                                     ...
#                                     CALIBRATION:
#                                     ...
#                                     The procedure used in computing the calibrated Electric Field and Magnetic Field                       
#                                      values found in this file can be obtained from the document 'cluster_wbd_calibration.pdf'.            
#                                      Because the calibration was applied in the time domain using a simple equation                        
#                                      the raw counts actually measured by the WBD instrument can be obtained by using                       
#                                      these equations and solving for 'Raw Counts', keeping in mind that this number                        
#                                      is an Integer ranging from 0 to 255.  Since DC offset is a real number, the                           
#                                      resultant when solving for raw counts will need to be converted to the nearest                        
#                                      whole number.                                                                                         
#                                     ...
#                                     CONVERSION TO FREQUENCY DOMAIN:
#                                     ...
#                                     In order to convert the WBD data to the frequency domain via an FFT, the following                     
#                                      steps need to be carried out:  1) If Electric Field, first divide calibrated                          
#                                      data values by 1000 to get V/m; 2) Apply window of preference, if any (such                           
#                                      as Hanning, etc.); 3) Divide data values by sqrt(2) to get back to the rms                            
#                                      domain; 4) perform FFT (see Bandwidth variable notes for non-continuous modes);                       
#                                      5) divide by the noise bandwidth, which is equal to the sampling frequency                            
#                                      divided by the FFT size (see table below for appropriate sampling frequency);                         
#                                      6) multiply by the appropriate constant for the window used, if any.                                  
#                                     ...
#                                     Bandwidth   Sample Rate
#                                     ---------   ------------
#                                     9.5 kHz      27.443 kHz
#                                     19 kHz       54.886 kHz
#                                     77 kHz      219.544 kHz
#                                     ...
#                                     COORDINATE SYSTEM USED:
#                                     ...
#                                     One axis measurements made in the Antenna Coordinate System, i.e., if electric                         
#                                      field measurement, it will either be Ey or Ez, both of which are in the spin                          
#                                      plane of the spacecraft, and if magnetic field measurement, it will either                            
#                                      be Bx, along the spin axis, or By, in spin plane.                                                     
#                                     ...
#     MODS                            Created Mar 2008.Revised Dec 2008, Jan 2010
#     ADID_REF                        NSSD0171
#     LOGICAL_FILE_ID                 c3_waveform_wbd_yyyymmddhhmm_v01
#     LOGICAL_SOURCE                  c3_waveform_wbd
#     LOGICAL_SOURCE_DESCRIPTION      Cluster Wideband Data Plasma Wave Receiver/High Time Resolution Waveform Data
#     PI_NAME                         2006 - Current:  J. S. Pickett; 1988 - 2006:  D. A. Gurnett
#     PI_AFFILIATION                  The University of  Iowa
#     MISSION_GROUP                   Cluster
#     INSTRUMENT_TYPE                 Radio and Plasma Waves (space)
#     HTTP_LINK                       http://www-pw.physics.uiowa.edu/cluster/
#                                     http://www.cosmos.esa.int/web/csa
#     GENERATION_DATE                 2010-01-20T16:43:37.000Z.
#     LINK_TITLE                      Cluster Wideband Plasma Wave Investigation
#                                     Cluster Science Archive
#     ACKNOWLEDGEMENT                 Users of the Cluster WBD data are encouraged to acknowledge NASA Goddard Space                         
#                                      Flight Center and The University of Iowa as the source of the data in any publication.                
#     RULES_OF_USE                    Cluster WBD data are open to everyone.  However, users of these data are encouraged                    
#                                      to contact the PI Institute should questions arise.                                                   
#     TIME_RESOLUTION                 1.0/Sample_rate
#     LINK_TEXT                       Overview and high time resolution spectrograms, documentation, and data coverage                       
#                                      files                                                                                                 
#                                     High time resolution spectrograms, documentation, and data coverage files
#     FILE_NAMING_CONVENTION          source_datatype_descriptor
#
#              ************************************
#              ****  RECORD VARYING VARIABLES  ****
#              ************************************
#
#  1. UT Time, time of WBD data point
#       NOTES:  On-board time is corrected to a precision of order 50 microseconds when compared to UTC. The applied time correction comes from the DWP TCOR time correction files located at the Cluster Active Archive (CAA).
#  2. Calibrated AC WBD Magnetic Field
#
#  
# Key Parameter and Survey data (labels K0,K1,K2) are preliminary browse data.
# Generated by CDAWeb on: Thu Jan 15 19:00:37 2015
VariableDescription.VariableInfo:
#  2. Calibrated AC WBD Magnetic Field
#
EPOCH                                     B-FIELD
dd-mm-yyyy hh:mm:ss.mil.mic.nan.pic            nT
03-02-2001 05:26:28.017.836.999.999  -1.00000E+31
